Air Fryer Bacon

Jump to Recipe

Are you ready to elevate your breakfast game with the perfect crispy bacon? Cooking bacon in an air fryer is not only quick and easy, but it also results in perfectly cooked strips with minimal mess! In this article, we’ll explore how to make Air Fryer Bacon using just a few simple ingredients. With an air fryer, you can achieve that delicious crunch without the splatter and hassle of frying on the stovetop. Whether you’re preparing a hearty breakfast or adding a savory touch to your favorite dishes, air-fried bacon is a game changer. Get ready to indulge in strips of perfectly cooked bacon that are crispy on the outside and tender on the inside, all in just a matter of minutes!

Ingredients

bacon strips

Choose thick-cut bacon for a meatier texture and enhanced chewiness, or opt for regular cut for a crispier bite. You can substitute turkey bacon or plant-based bacon for a healthier or vegetarian option, but keep in mind that cooking times may vary. For flavor enhancement, consider seasoning the bacon with a sprinkle of black pepper, brown sugar, or smoked paprika before cooking. When cooking, avoid overcrowding the basket to ensure even cooking and maximum crispiness.

Cooking Steps

  • Step 1: Preheat the Air Fryer

    Set your air fryer to 400°F (200°C) and let it preheat for about 5 minutes. This step is crucial as it ensures the bacon cooks evenly and crisps up nicely.

  • Step 2: Arrange the Bacon Strips

    Place 8-10 pieces of bacon strips in a single layer in the air fryer basket. Ensure the strips do not overlap to allow maximum air circulation, which is key to achieving that crispy texture.

  • Step 3: Cook the Bacon

    Cook the bacon for 8-10 minutes. It's a good idea to check the bacon halfway through cooking. You can flip the strips at this point if you prefer them extra crispy. Remember, cooking time may vary depending on the thickness of your bacon and your personal preference.

  • Step 4: Drain Excess Grease

    Once the bacon is cooked to your liking, carefully remove it from the air fryer using tongs. Place the bacon on a plate lined with paper towels to absorb any excess grease. This will help keep your bacon crispy and less greasy.

Frequently Asked Questions

What should I do if my bacon is sticking to the air fryer basket?

To prevent sticking, lightly spray the basket with cooking oil before placing the bacon strips in it. You can also use parchment paper designed for air fryers.

How do I know when the bacon is done?

Bacon is typically done when it reaches a golden brown color and is crispy. For a precise result, check for an internal temperature of 165°F (74°C).

Can I cook different types of bacon in the air fryer?

Yes! You can cook regular, turkey, or even plant-based bacon in the air fryer. Just adjust the cooking time slightly based on thickness and type.

What if I want my bacon extra crispy?

For extra crispy bacon, cook it for an additional 1-2 minutes, checking frequently to avoid burning.

Is it safe to leave the air fryer unattended while cooking bacon?

It's better to stay nearby while cooking bacon to monitor it closely, especially since bacon can cook quickly and fat can cause smoke.

How can I clean my air fryer after cooking bacon?

Once the air fryer has cooled, remove the basket and wash it with warm soapy water. You can also use a non-abrasive sponge to clean stubborn grease deposits.

Can I use the bacon grease from the air fryer?

Yes! You can save the bacon grease for cooking other dishes, but make sure to strain it to remove any food particles and store it in a sealed container in the fridge.

What’s the best way to store leftover bacon?

If you have leftover bacon, let it cool, then store it in an airtight container in the fridge for up to a week. You can reheat it in the air fryer or microwave.

How do I prevent grease from splattering while cooking?

Make sure to arrange the bacon strips in a single layer and avoid overcrowding. You can also place a piece of parchment paper over the top of the bacon to minimize splatter.

Can I cook other foods at the same time as bacon in the air fryer?

It's best to cook bacon alone in the air fryer because it releases a lot of grease, which may affect the cooking of other foods.

Additional Information

Dietary Considerations

For those with dietary preferences, turkey bacon or plant-based bacon alternatives can be used for a healthier or vegetarian option. Ensure that any added sauces are gluten-free if catering to gluten-sensitive guests. Additionally, consider serving with a side of fresh fruit or a yogurt parfait to balance the richness of the bacon.

Pairings

For a delightful breakfast experience, pair air-fried bacon with scrambled eggs, avocado toast, or pancakes. It also complements a classic BLT sandwich or can be crumbled over a fresh spinach salad. For beverages, consider serving with freshly brewed coffee, orange juice, or a mimosa for a brunch occasion.

Serving Suggestions

Serve the bacon on a warm plate, garnished with freshly chopped herbs like chives or parsley for a pop of color. For an elegant touch, you can drizzle a little maple syrup over the crispy strips or serve alongside a dipping sauce like spicy mustard or honey for added flavor. If you're hosting a brunch, consider laying out a bacon bar where guests can add toppings or sauces of their choice.
